text:
="preserve">Herman Mandui (1969 - October 4, 2014) was an archaeologist from Papua New Guinea.
Mandui is regarded as the "godfather" of archaeology in his country. He worked on several archaeological sites, for example in the Western Highlands Province and in the eastern Goilala District.
He was the Chief Archeologist of Papua New Guinea from 2008 until his death in 2014.
